docs.title: Getting started
docs.text: This repository provides all the necessary resources to install the Pulsar API, along with comprehensive documentation and examples to help you get started using the Pulsar Actuator or Motor. It includes detailed descriptions of available classes and methods.

docs.title: Installing the Pulsar API into your own Environment
docs.text:
We recommend using a virtual environment to manage dependencies. However, you may also install the package directly into your system’s Python environment if preferred. To create and activate your own virtual environment, follow these steps: 

python -m venv PulsarVenv
Once created, transfer the generated .whl file to the designated personal directory to proceed with the installation. In this instance, the target distribution is version 0.9.1, specifically pcp_api-0.9.1-py3-none-any.whl Next, utilize Python’s package manager, pip, to install the package into the active environment. Begin by activating the appropriate virtual environment to ensure the package is installed in the correct context.

LinuxWindows 
source PulsarVenv/bin/activate

.\PulsarVenv\Scripts\Activate.ps1

Now we install the package using pip:

LinuxWindows 
pip install pcp_api-0.9.1-py3-none-any.whl

pip install pcp_api-0.9.1-py3-none-any.whl

IMPORTANT NOTE

This command is installing the version 0.9.1, if you have a newer version modify the name of the file accordingly.

docs.title: Code examples
docs.text:
add_numbers.py
# Function to add two numbers
def add_two_numbers(num1, num2):
    return num1 + num2

# Example usage
result = add_two_numbers(5, 3)
print('The sum is:', result)
